required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Performance Study to Validate the Use of Novel Molecular Diagnostic Assays for the Detection of Cancer Biomarkers in Peripheral Blood and Primary Tumor Tissue of Patients With Recurrent/Metastatic HNSCC, Metastatic NSCLC or Metastatic Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Performance Study to Validate the Use of Novel Molecular Diagnostic Assays for the Detection of Cancer Biomarkers in Peripheral Blood and Primary Tumor Tissue of Patients With Recurrent/Metastatic Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC), Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) or Metastatic Melanoma.

brief_summary.textblock:
Conventional biopsy and surgical tumor resection are invasive procedures that capture only one instance of the progression of the tumor. However, the genome of tumor is not static, but it is constantly altered during treatment.
Liquid biopsy is a non-invasive approach based on the extraction of information through peripheral blood analysis. It makes it possible to characterize the development of a solid tumor in real time, through detailed molecular analysis of circulating genetic material in peripheral blood.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical performance of PD-L1 kit in CTCs of peripheral blood and tumor tissue samples
primary_outcome.description: The performance of PD-L1 kit at baseline in CTCs (using IF as reference method) and tumor tissue samples (using IHC as reference method) will be assessed via Sensitivity, Specificity, Positive and Negative Predictive Values, Positive and Negative Likelihood Ratios, Accuracy and Diagnostic Odds Ratio.

secondary_outcome.measure: To study correlations between PD-L1 expression in serial liquid samples with patients' responsiveness to therapy.
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response to the selected treatment (CR, PR, SD, PD) Survival status

other_outcome.measure: To study mutation status of BRAF gene in tumor tissue samples and blood samples (CTC, plasma ctDNA) of metastatic melanoma patients
other_outcome.description: Mutation profile of BRAF in CTCs, plasma-ctDNA and tumor tissues of metastatic melanoma patients will be evaluated using PCR-molecular assays

other_outcome.measure: To study the presence of biomarkers in tumor tissue and blood liquid biopsy samples (at baseline).
other_outcome.description: Molecular profile of cancer biomarkers in tumor tissue and peripheral blood samples will be evaluated using PCR-molecular assays

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

arm_group.description: In case of healhty volunteers, only peripheral blood samples will be collected.

intervention.description: Clinical performance of PD-L1 kit in CTCs of peripheral blood and tumor tissue samples

study_pop.textblock: 155 subjects as follows: 25 patients with metastatic/recurrent HNSCC 120 patients with metastatic NSCLC 10 patients with metastatic melanoma 30 healthy subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female aged ≥ 18 years of age.
2. Patients with a diagnosis of
1. recurrent or metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC), who are going to receive PD-1 inhibitor nivolumab OR
2. metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC), who are going to receive PD-1 inhibitor, e.g. nivolumab, pembrolizumab,OR
3. metastatic melanoma, who are going to receive to receive PD-1 inhibitor, e.g. nivolumab, pembrolizumab.
3. Available tumor tissue sample for immunohistochemical and molecular analysis.
4. Life expectancy ≥ 4 months.
5. Signed informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female younger than 18 years old.
2. History of another malignancy within 3 years or current 2nd primary malignancy.
3. Patients that have not signed the informed consent.

facility.name: Sotiria Thoracic Diseases Hospital of Athens
University General Hospital of Athens Attikon

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
